clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of a Real Time Radiation Monitoring Device on Radiation Exposure During Cardiac Catheterization
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of a Real Time Radiation Monitoring Device on Radiation Exposure During Cardiac Catheterization

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine the impact of using a real time radiation exposure monitoring device on the patient and operator radiation exposure during cardiac catheterization. The hypothesis of the study is that use of a real time radiation exposure monitoring device during cardiac catheterization will decrease both patient and operator radiation exposure compared to no use of the monitoring device.

primary_outcome.time_frame: radiation exposure will be measured for the duration of the catheterization procedure, an expected average of one hour
primary_outcome.description: Radiation exposure of the operator (measured in mrem by the real time monitoring device)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: radiation exposure will be measured for the duration of the catheterization procedure, an expected average of one hour
secondary_outcome.description: Radiation exposure of the patient, as measured by the X-ray machine using (a) air kerma dose, (b) dose area product, (c) fluoroscopy and cineangiography time
